content.question:
A linear regression model was fit to a set of data containing 18 observations. The computer output of the regression analysis is shown in the table.

Term 

<math alttext="coefficient" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mtext>Coef</mtext></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="standard error of the coefficient" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mtext>SE Coef</mtext></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

Constant 
12.00 
5.43 
2.210 

<math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold-italic"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> 
0.694 
0.241 
2.880 

Assume the conditions for regression are met. Which of the following defines the margin of error when a 95 percent confidence interval for the slope of the least-squares regression line is calculated?

topic.text: 9.2: Confidence Intervals for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
